interface.name: mount_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute mount in the mount domain.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The type of the process performing this action.

interface.name: mount_run
interface.summary: Execute mount in the mount domain, and allow the specified role the mount domain, and use the caller's terminal.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The type of the process performing this action.

param.name: role
param.summary: The role to be allowed the mount domain.

param.name: terminal
param.summary: The type of the terminal allow the mount domain to use.

interface.name: mount_exec
interface.summary: Execute mount in the caller domain.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The type of the process performing this action.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The type of the process performing this action.

interface.name: mount_send_nfs_client_request
interface.summary: Allow the mount domain to send nfs requests for mounting network drives

desc.p: Allow the mount domain to send nfs requests for mounting network drives
This interface has been deprecated as these rules were a side effect of leaked mount file descriptors. This interface has no effect.

interface.name: mount_domtrans_unconfined
interface.summary: Execute mount in the unconfined mount domain.

desc.p: Allow mount to mount any file
